Unsourced material may be challenged and removed. *Find sources:* "Rochor" – news **·** newspapers **·** books **·** scholar **·** JSTOR *(January 2017)* *(Learn how and when to remove this message)*Planning Area in Central Region, Singapore **Rochor** ([IPA](/wiki/International_Phonetic_Alphabet): /ˈroʊtʃoʊ, -ɔːr/ *ROH-choh* or *ROH-chor*) is a [planning area](/wiki/Planning_Areas_of_Singapore) located within the [Central Area](/wiki/Central_Area,_Singapore) of the [Central Region](/wiki/Central_Region,_Singapore) of Singapore. Rochor shares boundaries with the following planning areas – [Kallang](/wiki/Kallang) to the north and east, [Newton](/wiki/Newton,_Singapore) to the west, as well as [Museum](/wiki/Museum_Planning_Area) and the [Downtown Core](/wiki/Downtown_Core) to the south. Rochor has 10 subzones. These are Bencoolen, [Farrer Park](/wiki/Farrer_Park), [Kampung Glam](/wiki/Kampung_Glam), [Little India](/wiki/Little_India,_Singapore), Mackenzie, Mount Emily, Rochor Canal, Selegie, [Sungei Road](/wiki/Sungei_Road) and Victoria. ## Shopping centres ### The Verge The Verge, formerly **Tekka Mall**, is the first and largest modern shopping centre at [Little India](/wiki/Little_India,_Singapore) in Rochor, Singapore. It opened in 2003. The Verge has two buildings, the main building and **Chill @ The Verge**. It is located in the southern part of Little India, with the main building located on the junction of [Serangoon Road](/wiki/Serangoon_Road) and [Sungei Road](/wiki/Sungei_Road) and the Chill @ The Verge located on the junction of Perak Road and [Sungei Road](/wiki/Sungei_Road). Both of the buildings are separated by Clive Road and the mall lies opposite [Tekka Centre](/wiki/Tekka_Centre) across Serangoon Road. On 16 July 2008, the mall was revamped, which also brought about the name change from Tekka Mall to The Verge. ### Tekka Centre Tekka Centre is a relatively smaller shopping centre in Little India, Rochor. On the ground floor is a [hawker centre](/wiki/Hawker_centre) with stalls which sell Indian vegetarian meals, served on banana leaves or on [stainless steel](/wiki/Stainless_steel) [platters](/wiki/Platter_(dishware)), besides Chinese vegetarian, [North Indian](/wiki/North_India) and Malay food. At the wet market which is on the same level, stalls sell fresh seafood, especially crabs from [Sri Lanka](/wiki/Sri_Lanka), and vegetables. There are also many Chinese stalls selling vegetables that are specially flown in from India. ## Transportation [Rochor MRT station](/wiki/Rochor_MRT_station) is a [Mass Rapid Transit](/wiki/Mass_Rapid_Transit_(Singapore)) station on the [Downtown line](/wiki/Downtown_Line) Stage 2 in Singapore, formerly known as the Bukit Timah line. The station links the [East West line](/wiki/East_West_MRT_line) and the [North East line](/wiki/North_East_Line) along the [Bukit Timah](/wiki/Bukit_Timah) corridor, serving the commercial areas to the south of [Little India](/wiki/Little_India,_Singapore). This station was originally planned to interchange itself but the plan was abandoned. ## Notable places - [2 Kampong Kapor Road](/wiki/2_Kampong_Kapor_Road) - [Selegie House](/wiki/Selegie_House) - [Sophia Flats](/wiki/Sophia_Flats), a three-storey apartment block of colonial architecture - Street directory This [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore) location article is a stub.
